sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now. I'm Tecumseh Salako with your top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: More countries report their first cases of the Omicron variant as some scientists express concern that vaccines will be less effective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin threatens to use hypersonic missiles against the West if NATO crosses Russia's red lines over Ukraine security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: missiles against the West if NATO crosses Russia's red lines over Ukraine security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And on World AIDS Day, we'll be looking at how to improve awareness and prevention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: As the cases of the new COVID variant spread, it's now in at least 20 countries, it turns out the Omicron strain was spreading around the world more than a week earlier than when South African scientists detected it. Since then, numerous governments have begun imposing travel bans on countries in southern Africa. Spain has become the latest, suspending flights from December 2nd until the 15th. But the WHO says travel bans don't work and other measures should be employed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: We need to use the measures that we know and we need to use the measures that we know that work. The mask wearing whenever possible and advisable as long as you're in a room with more than one person, ventilating a room if possible as often as possible, keeping the normal hand and body hygiene and especially hand and mouth hygiene in those circumstances. Many countries are focusing on upping their vaccination programmes to get booster jabs in as many arms as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: The UK, for example, is launching what Prime Minister Boris Johnson has termed a jab army, setting an end of January deadline for all adults to have a third shot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: Other nations, such as Austria, which is extending its nationwide lockdown to 20 days, are making vaccinations mandatory. In Greece, the over-60s will have to have a compulsory shot against the virus from January the 16th, or a fine will be added to tax bills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: But the new variant has sparked worries that it could resist current vaccines, and that's not been helped by the boss of Moderna, casting doubt over their effectiveness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Despite concerns that existing vaccines may be less effective against the new variant, immunologist Professor Luke O'Neill told Euronews that booster shots could still provide a strong line of defence. We know that the antibody effect might go down against Omicron, but quantity can trump quality, basically.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The more antibody you've got, the more likely it is you'll neutralise this virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And the boosters do exactly that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: We know from Israel, for example, you get a massive antibody response with the booster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: So even though the antibody quality's gone a bit, it's just still a work against Omicron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And so we should get the boosters into people as soon as we can.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And I'm saying Ireland should follow the UK now, all the over-18s, and very importantly, shorten the gap between the second and third shot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: At the moment, it's five months, for example, in Ireland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: The UK are moving to three months as a gap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And I would say every country really should follow that lead and shorten that time between the second and third shot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: NATO foreign ministers are meeting in the Latvian capital Riga amid worries over a build-up of Russian troops on the border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg warned that any invasion by Russia would have consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Several times now, there will be a high price to pay for Russia if they once again use force against the independent sovereign nation, Ukraine. We have demonstrated our ability to impose costs, economic, political actions. But Russian President Vladimir Putin warned that he would respond if NATO deploys troops or weapons to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If some kind of strike system appears on the territory of Ukraine, the flight time to Moscow will be seven to ten minutes, five minutes in the case of hypersonic weapons being deployed. We will have to create something similar in relation to those who threaten us in that way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: And we can do that now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Stoltenberg called on Moscow to re-engage in the NATO-Russia Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He also called for all countries to increase predictability and transparency for increased global security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: Russia's military build-up near Ukrainian borders probably is one of the main questions here at NATO Foreign Ministers Summit in Riga.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: US State Secretary Antony Blinken as well as NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg, said today that Russia will pay high price if any military action against Ukraine will take place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: Poland, as well as Baltic countries, also wants to talk about migrant crisis created by Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: They say that these two events happening at the same time, and it's not a coincidence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: But more broader, ministers will be discussing new NATO strategic concept. That document was adopted previously 10 years ago when Russia was treated as a partner but China was not mentioned at all. The new document also will face and look how to deal with cyber and hybrid threats that NATO is facing now. Janis Lijsens, Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: A 15-year-old suspect has been taken into custody by police

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: following a shooting at a school in the US state of Michigan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Three people died in the incident, with several more injured, including a teacher.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Police say the suspect fired 15 to 20 shots with a semi-automatic weapon and acted alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The assailant's motive for the attack in the town of Oxford, about 65 kilometres from Detroit, remain unclear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A pilot has testified in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell that he flew VIPs, including Bill Clinton and Donald Trump, in paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein's private plane. Larry Vesoski recalled flying Virginia Roberts Giffrey, who has accused British monarch Prince Andrew of sexually assaulting her. Ghislaine Maxwell is facing trial for recruiting and grooming underage girls for sexual abuse. The EU have announced that the Eurozone's annual inflation rate hit 4.9 percent in november the highest since records began in 1997. the inflation spike was largely blamed on a rise in energy prices and the cost of the economic recovery following the coronavirus pandemic the european central bank has insisted that inflationary pressures would be temporary and likely to fall in 2022 would be temporary and likely to fall in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The French Supreme Court will announce today whether or not former President Nicolas Sarkozy will have to stand trial on corruption charges related to his 2007 presidential campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Our international correspondent, Anneliese Borges, has more from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Nicolas Sarkozy and several of his close advisors are accused of having accepted money from former Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi. An investigation was opened back in 2013 and since then Sarkozy was indicted several times. There are seven different cases against him and earlier this year back in September he was found guilty and sentenced to one year in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: That followed another conviction six months earlier when he was found guilty of corruption and influence peddling. Throughout the last few years, Nicolas Sarkozy has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing and says he is the victim of a vast left-wing plot to destroy him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The man who led France from 2007 to 2012 has retained relevance among conservatives here in this country and was reportedly involved in the camp's choosing of a presidential candidate for the race next year. Anneliese Borch is in Paris for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Josephine Baker has become the first black woman to receive France's highest honor,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: being inducted into the Pantheon. Baker was an artist, anti-nazi spy and activist. Born in Missouri she ended up living in France in 1925. Baker became a French citizen after her marriage to industrialist Jean Lyon. In 1939 she started to work for France's counterintelligence services against the Nazis. After the war, she engaged in many social causes, especially anti-racism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: HER CAUSE WAS THE UNIVERSALISM, THE UNITY OF THE HUMAN RACE, THE EQUALITY OF ALL BEFORE THE IDENTITY OF EACH, HOSPITALITY FOR ALL DIFFERENCES UNITED BY THE SAME WILL, THE SAME Hospitality for all differences, united by the same will, the same dignity, emancipation against affectation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Baker, who became synonymous with the glitz and free-spirited energy of the French capital, was also celebrated by a Parisian metro station being renamed in her honor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: What to do about keeping tourism safe and sustainable? That's the focus of a UN meeting of travel organizations in Madrid we'll be visiting after this break. December the 1st marks World AIDS Day, the first ever global health day. But this year, people living with HIV say the COVID-19 pandemic

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: has diverted crucial resources from the fight against AIDS.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And now they say they're being left behind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Thomas Blade has more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With December 1st marking World AIDS Day, many HIV charities are questioning the resource drain COVID-19 is having on global health systems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the Democratic Republic of the Congo, those living with HIV and AIDS complain of being deprived of their access to care.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Jean-Louis and his wife Odette are both HIV positive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Before, we used to have food rations. That doesn't exist anymore. That's all in the past.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The medical care, the financing in the HIV sector, all that no longer exists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A recent UNAIDS report noted that COVID-19 lockdowns and other restrictions have badly disrupted HIV testing around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In many countries, this has led to steep drops in HIV diagnoses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In terms of supply, we depend a lot from abroad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We need to keep asking so that we don't have a break in supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And as for the funding with the arrival of COVID and Ebola, the funding has dried up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Both patients and carers know that without international support they'll never see an end to the AIDS epidemic in the DRC.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Rita Boncampani Ludovici opens the doors of one of Italy's most famous villas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Texan native inherited Casino dell'Aurora following the death of her aristocratic husband.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And what makes this Roman residence stand out?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It contains a one-of-a-kind Caravaggio artwork.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This work is unique because it's a mural by Caravaggio, who did no other mural paintings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: All his works were on canvas. It's a mythological subject and this too is a bit of a unicorn, or almost, because it represents the three Greek divinities who preside over the sky, the sea and the earth, namely Jupiter, Neptune and Pluto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Diplomat and patron of the arts Cardinal Del Monte commissioned Caravaggio's masterpiece in 1597. It's so important to future generations and I think to Italy too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I think this house is important for Italians. It shouldn't be made into an apartment building or business. It shouldn't. Now the villa is set to have a new owner with the house up for auction next year the 2 800 square meter estate with lush gardens and of course its hidden masterpiece is worth 471 million euros it's lunchtime in bangkok and

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: in this branch of a th restaurant chain, the latest specialty on the menu is being prepared. However, the main ingredient for this pizza is not tomatoes, cheese or olives, but cannabis. Thailand recently relaxed its strict narcotics laws, becoming the first country in Southeast Asia to remove certain parts and extracts of cannabis from its controlled drugs list. But the question is, can people get high from eating the pizza?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Of course they cannot get high. It's just a marketing campaign and you can taste the cannabis taste and then if you have it enough, you maybe get a bit sleepy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Since February, the controlled use of the plant in food and beverages has been allowed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: And businesses are taking advantage of this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: People get excited because it's new.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They've never seen this kind of thing before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But in the next few years, I would rather say using cannabis is a trend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But nobody knows how long it will last.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Cannabis is infused within the ingredients of the pizza, but there are strict rules over who can and cannot buy it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Companies are not allowed to sell the product to anyone under the age of 12. For approximately 13 euros, tourists and locals can taste the crazy happy pizza throughout Thailand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Construction of a Baltic sea tunnel has officially begun on the German island of Fehrman in Schleswig-Holstein.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The controversial billion-dollar deal aims to build an 18-kilometer tunnel to connect Germany and Denmark.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: German and Danish politicians described the tunnel as the project of the century at the groundbreaking ceremony on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The mood is good. It really takes a load off my mind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Because to get such a planning approval procedure through, to get the right to build before the Federal Administrative Court for such a huge project that's been running for decades, that's a real relief.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: In Denmark, construction has already been underway since 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: But in Germany, building was delayed after more than 12,000 objections to the project were received, with environmental groups and ferry companies filing lawsuits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The tunnel is important for Denmark and for Germany and for all of Europe because it really connects Europe. It is a very good way to make sure that we can switch from planes to trains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The combined road and rail tunnel is expected to be ready by 2029. Denmark will bear an estimated 7.1 billion euros in construction costs for the tunnel, while Germany will pay an estimated 3.5 billion euros for the road and rail link. In the future, the tunnel will cut the journey time between Hamburg and Copenhagen to around two and a half hours, at least two hours less than today. The Schleswig-Holstein transport minister says he hopes this project will bring in additional jobs and more tourists to the region. The new COVID-19 wave is not good news for the tourism sector. The United Nations

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: World Tourism Organization's 24th General Assembly is held in Madrid against the backdrop of the Omicron variant. It's the first face-to-face assembly since the pandemic began. It will approve, among others, a legal code to secure travelers' stock at the borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What the code allows is to give guarantees to all these people who face the generalized closure of borders and who may find themselves stranded in a different country, to give them guarantees with regard to what basic assistance they will receive, what type of assistance, under what conditions, who's responsible for providing basic assistance, is it the government, the companies and how they coordinate with each other to guarantee that these tourists don't find themselves in a precarious situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sustainability, digitalisation and understanding the new trends of travellers will also be key.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's going to be very interesting for us to discuss also here at the General Assembly what are the new tendencies for the guests, for the travellers. What do they want to do after the pandemic? They want to go towards slower tourism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is what we see.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They want to explore nature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They want to avoid massive crowds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So the investors and we, the state, we have to take into account these new tendencies, these new, let's say, preferences and make competent policies for this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Countries keep rethinking how to ensure a tourism that preserves biodiversity based on economic and social development.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sustainability will be the main topic on the table in Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Sustainability, solidarity, inclusion, not only social but also economic, cultural and environmental.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The pandemic shows us the profound footprint of tourism and the incredibly broad value chain. It's reinforced the message that we have always promoted. The UNWTO assures that border closures and the cancellation of flights from Africa, which could derail expectations of tourism recovery for next year are not the solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_19
sentences.sentence: Joint measures must be taken in solidarity, they say, to deal with the new variants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Cristina Giner, Euronews.com.
